newsitem.title: FRANCE: LVMH says not interested in Bulgari.
newsitem.headline: LVMH says not interested in Bulgari.

text.p: French luxury goods conglomerate LVMH denied a rumour circulating in the stock market that it was interested in buying or taking a stake in jeweller Bulgari.
"We deny having any interest in Bulgari," an LVMH spokeswoman told Reuters.
LVMH shares were up 2.97 percent at 1,458 francs at 1205 GMT.
Brokers attributed the rise to rumours that the group was interested in Bulgari and to expectations that brokerage Cheuvreux de Virieu was about to issue a favourable study.
Portfolio managers said they had been advised that the study would examine the value of LVMH, taking into account the integration of the U.S. duty-free chain DFS.
An LVMH acquisition of majority control of DFS hinges on the approval of U.S. antitrust authorities, expected before the middle of the month.
Cheuvreux has maintained its high "1" rating on LVMH.

The Bulgari rumour was fuelled by the strong rise in Bulgari shares in the Milan bourse, a portfolio manager said. The firm, which originated as a manufacturer of luxury watches, has diversified into perfumes and silk scarves, and is growing fast.
One manager dismissed the Bulgari rumour, saying the purchase would be dilutive for LVMH.
LVMH has been on the acquisition trail, and one of its recent purchases has been that of jeweller Fred.
